replies.body: Swain's one of the champions we're looking at for smaller adjustments in the mid season mage patch, along the lines of those Lucian and Twitch got in the Marksmen update. No confirmed direction/details for those changes yet though.

That sounds like a good idea. Swain's too predictable and easy to outplay. All you ever have to do is waveclear and roam while he struggles to clear mid. This is why I think he didn't need a nerf. I don't think such a style is actually good in competitive or higher ELO. I've played him a lot before giving up on him due to this exact reason. You're an amazing duelist and teamfighter but they can just waveclear and avoid you/splitpush. If he had solid mana efficient waveclear he'd probably be broken though.
He is also a massive lane bully, the W nerf was to nerf his ability to catch and hold people in the early game.

Honestly the Swain issue is one of the things that really makes me think there is a huge AD biased problem with the balance team.

Swain and Brand started getting up there in win% with Swain around 54% (I own Swain I think hes cool so I remember his %) and they were like "OH NO, cant have that, NERFS!"

Graves sits up at the number 1 win % in the game for a while, then patch time comes around and no Graves nerfs, just a mention that "he may have to be checked."

WTF!?

Swain wasnt #1 in the game gets immediate nerfs, Graves (who was on sale during that patch...) goes through two patches as #1 in jungle, top lane, and like #3 as ADC with the overall highest win % in the game, no panic fixes for him...

Swain also got what people referred to as "Sejuanied" - Verb, to nerf the champion because of their synergy with an item or ability, then to have said item or ability nerfed and leave the original champion nerfs in play thus ultimately just nerfing a champion to make them weaker than they were before said item or ability.

Swain got nerfed, then Deathfire Touch got changes, Swain left as is; he got Sejuanied.

I mean tell me if Im off, but honestly its starting to feel like the balance team is throwing darts. I think there may be a magnet behind the "buff AD champs" part of the dart board.
